封筒の裏に彼の住所を書いてしまった。
column2: I've written his address on the back of the envelope.

column1:
What does this mean?

封筒をください。
column2: I need an envelope.

column1:
What does this mean?

封筒に切手を貼りなさい。
column2: Stick a stamp on the envelope.

column1:
What does this mean?

封筒に６０円の切手を貼ってくれますか。
column2: Will you please stick a 60-yen stamp on the envelope?

column1:
What does this mean?

封切られたばかりの映画はなんですか。
column2: What movies just opened?

column1:
What does this mean?

部長の都合が悪くなってしまったので、飲み会の日程は仕切り直しだね。
column2: We'll have to organize the drinking party all over again as the section chief can't make it now.

column1:
What does this mean?

部長が不在のときはブラウン氏が業務を管理する。
column2: Mr. Brown is in charge of the business in the absence of the manager.

column1:
What does this mean?

部下は彼のあとに続いた。
column2: The men followed him.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋番号をお願いします。
column2: Your room number, please?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋探しは苦労することがある。
column2: Finding an apartment can be difficult.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を片付けなさい。
column2: Put your room in order.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を片付けた後彼女は外出した。
column2: After the room was tidied up, she went out.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を変えられますか。
column2: Could I change rooms?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を通り抜けて庭に出た。
column2: I went through the room into the garden.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を替えてください。
column2: Please change my room?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を掃除するように命じましたか。
column2: Did you order the room to be swept?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を掃除することが娘の仕事です。
column2: Sweeping the room is my daughter's job.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を掃除しなさい。
column2: You must clean your room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を掃除してもらった。
column2: I had my room cleaned.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を整頓しなさい。
column2: Put your room in order.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出ろ。
column2: You must go out of the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出る前に明かりを消して下さい。
column2: Please turn out the light before leaving the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときは必ず明かりを消してね。
column2: Be sure to turn out the light when you go out of the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときは電灯を消して下さい。
column2: Please put the light out when you leave the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときは、明かりを消したかどうか確かめて下さい。
column2: When you leave the room, please make sure you turn off the lights.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときには明かりを消しなさい。
column2: Turn off the lights when you leave the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときには、必ず電気を消してください。
column2: Be sure to turn off the light when you leave the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るときに、彼は私にお辞儀をした。
column2: Leaving the room, he bowed to me.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出るとき、彼は電気を消した。
column2: Leaving the room, he turned off the light.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出てはいけません。
column2: You are not to leave your room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を取ってくれませんか。
column2: Will you get me a room?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を出た後はドアを閉めなさい。
column2: Close the door after you when you leave the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋を花で飾った。
column2: They adorned the room with flowers.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋をきれいにしましょうか。
column2: Shall I clean the room?

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は来客のために暖かくしておかれた。
column2: The room was kept warm for the guests.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は明るくして彼は手紙を読むことができた。
column2: The room was light enough for him to read the letter.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は墓場のように静かだった。
column2: The room was as still as the grave.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は暖かかった。
column2: The room was warm.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は真っ暗だった。
column2: The room was in complete darkness.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は散らかり放題だった。
column2: The room was in total disorder.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は散らかし放題だった。
column2: The room was all messed up.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は花でいっぱいです。
column2: The room is full of flowers.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は煙でいっぱいで、ほとんど息ができないくらいだった。
column2: The room was so full of smoke that I could hardly breathe.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋は暗かったが、私はその本を簡単に見つけた。
column2: I found the book easily though it was dark in the room.

column1:
What does this mean?

部屋はほったらかしのままだった。
column2: The room was in a state of neglect.
